intro: Morna, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant produces showy, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center, often blooming in clusters. Morna typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens. Its botanical features make it both ornamental and ecologically valuable in its native habitat.
